prompt.name: Search for a One-Way Trip
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches for a one-way trip between two stations.

input.search_input: From: New York, NY - Moynihan Train Hall (NYP), To: Washington, DC - Union Station (WAS), select a date
input.action: 'Enter `New York, NY - Moynihan Train Hall (NYP)` in the 'From' field', 'Enter `Washington, DC - Union Station (WAS)` in the 'To' field', 'Select a departure date as 18 July 2025', 'Click the `Find Trains` button'

expected.outcome: The user is presented with a list of available trains for the selected route and date.

prompt.name: Search for a Round Trip
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches for a round trip between two stations.

input.search_input: From: Chicago, IL - Union Station (CHI), To: Seattle, WA - King Street Station (SEA), select a departure and return date
input.action: 'Click the `Round-Trip` radio button', 'Enter `Chicago, IL - Union Station (CHI)` in the 'From' field', 'Enter `Seattle, WA - King Street Station (SEA)` in the 'To' field', 'Select a departure date as 18 July 2025', 'Select a return date as 25 July 2025', 'Click the `Find Trains` button'

expected.outcome: The user is presented with a list of available trains for the selected route and dates.

prompt.name: Check Train Status
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User checks the status of a train using the 'Check Status' feature.

input.search_input: From: Boston, MA - South Station (BOS), To: New York, NY - Moynihan Train Hall (NYP)
input.action: 'Click the `TRAIN STATUS` tab', 'Enter `Boston, MA - South Station (BOS)` in the `From` field', 'Enter `New York, NY - Moynihan Train Hall (NYP)` in the `To` field', 'Click on `CHECK STATUS`'

expected.outcome: The user is shown the status of trains on the selected route.

prompt.name: Find Trip
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User attempts to find a trip using a reservation number and email.

input.action: 'Click the `MY TRIP` tab', 'Enter `123456` in the `Reservation/Ticket Number` field', 'Select `Email Address`', 'Enter `test@example.com` in the `Email Address` field', 'Click on `FIND TRIP`'

expected.outcome: The user is shown an error message indicating the trip cannot be found, as the reservation is fictional.

prompt.name: Change Language to Spanish
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User changes the website's language to Spanish.

input.action: 'Click on the `English` link in the header', 'Select `Espa√±ol` from the dropdown menu'

expected.outcome: The website content is displayed in Spanish.

prompt.name: Access Deals Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Deals' page from the main navigation.

input.action: 'Click on the `DEALS` link in the main navigation bar', 'Click on `See current promotions`'

expected.outcome: The 'Deals' page is displayed, showing all the available deals.

prompt.name: Access Schedules Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Schedules' page from the main navigation.

input.action: 'Click on the `SCHEDULES` link in the main navigation bar', 'Enter `Boston, MA - South Station (BOS)` in the `From` field', 'Enter `Newton, KS (NEW)` in the `To` field', 'Select dates as 18 July 2025 and 25 July 2025', 'Click on `FIND SCHEDULE`'

expected.outcome: The 'Timetable' page is displayed with available trips.

prompt.name: Access Plan Page
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Plan' page from the main navigation.

input.action: 'Click on the `PLAN` link in the main navigation bar', 'Click on `More about trip planning`'

expected.outcome: The 'Plan Your Train Travel' page is displayed.

prompt.name: Use the 'Ask Julie' chatbot
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User opens and interacts with the 'Ask Julie' chatbot.

input.action: 'Click on `Need Help?` in the page main navigation', 'Click on the `Ask Julie` button', 'Type `What is the baggage allowance?` into the chat input', 'Click search icon'

expected.outcome: The chatbot search icon is clicked.

prompt.name: Explore Onboard Features (Baggage)
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the baggage information page.

input.action: 'Scroll down to the `Onboard Experience` section', 'Click on the `Baggage` tab', 'Click on `Baggage information and services`'

expected.outcome: The baggage information page is displayed.

prompt.name: Explore Onboard Features (Seating)
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the seating options page.

input.action: 'Scroll down to the `Onboard Experience` section', 'Click on the `Seating` tab', 'Click on `Seat options and features`'

expected.outcome: The seating options page is displayed.

prompt.name: Explore Onboard Features (Dining)
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the dining options page.

input.action: 'Scroll down to the `Onboard Experience` section', 'Click on the `Food & Dining` tab', 'Click on `Dining options and menus`'

expected.outcome: The dining options page is displayed.

prompt.name: View Everyday Discounts
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'Everyday Discounts' page.

input.action: 'Click on the `DEALS` link in the main navigation', 'Click on `See all discounts` under the `Everyday Discounts` section'

expected.outcome: The everyday discounts page is displayed, showing discounts for various groups.

prompt.name: Manage Cookie Preferences
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User opens the cookie preferences and rejects all non-essential cookies.

input.action: 'Click on the `Customize Settings` button in the cookie banner', 'Click on `Reject All`', 'Click on `Confirm My Choices`'

expected.outcome: The cookie preferences are saved and the banner disappears.

prompt.name: Access the Mobile App page
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the page with information about the Amtrak mobile app.

input.action: 'Scroll down to the `Trip Planning Map` section', 'Click on the `Mobile App` tab', 'Click on `GET THE APP`'

expected.outcome: The user is taken to a page with information and links to download the Amtrak mobile app.

prompt.name: Detailed Trip Search with Passenger Types
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User performs a one-way search with two adults, one child, and one senior.

input.search_input: From: Los Angeles, CA - Union Station (LAX), To: San Francisco, CA - Salesforce Plaza (SFC), with 2 adults, 1 child, 1 senior
input.action: 'Enter `Los Angeles, CA - Union Station (LAX)` in the 'From' field', 'Enter `San Francisco, CA - Salesforce Plaza (SFC)` in the 'To' field', 'Select the departure date as 18 July 2025', 'Click on `1 Passenger`', 'Increase `Adults` to `2`', 'Increase `Children (2-12)` to `1`', 'Increase `Seniors (65+)` to `1`', 'Click `Done`','Click the `Find Trains` button'

expected.outcome: The user is presented with a list of available trains and prices calculated for the specified passenger types.

prompt.name: Round-trip Search with Future Dates
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User searches for a round trip several months in the future.

input.search_input: From: Washington, DC - Union Station (WAS), To: Orlando, FL (ORL) for a week-long trip in 3 months
input.action: 'Click the `Round-Trip` radio button', 'Enter `Washington, DC - Union Station (WAS)` in the 'From' field', 'Enter `Orlando, FL (ORL)` in the 'To' field', 'Select a departure date three months from now', 'Select a return date one week after the departure date', 'Click the `Find Trains` button'

expected.outcome: The user is presented with a list of available trains for the selected future dates.

prompt.name: Multi-Ride & Rail Passes Exploration
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the rail passes page and explores the USA Rail Pass.

input.action: 'Click on the `DEALS` link in the main navigation', 'Click on `USA Rail Pass`', 'Review the details of the USA Rail Pass', 'Click on `Purchase` button'

expected.outcome: The user is taken to the page to purchase a USA Rail Pass.

prompt.name: Amtrak Vacations Exploration
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User explores vacation packages available on Amtrak Vacations.

input.action: 'Click on the `DEALS` link in the main navigation', 'Click on `Amtrak Vacations`', 'On the Amtrak Vacations site, click on a featured vacation package', 'Review the details of the package'

expected.outcome: The user successfully navigates to the Amtrak Vacations website and views a vacation package.

prompt.name: Find a Station and Check Details
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User uses the 'Find Station' feature to get details about a specific station.

input.search_input: New Orleans, LA - Union Passenger Terminal (NOL)
input.action: 'Click on the `PLAN` link in the main navigation', 'Click on `Find Station/Route`', 'Enter `New Orleans, LA` in the search input', 'Select `New Orleans, LA - Union Passenger Terminal (NOL)` from the results', 'Review the station details page for address and hours'

expected.outcome: The station details page for New Orleans Union Passenger Terminal is displayed, showing address, hours, and other information.

prompt.name: Track a Train by Number
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User attempts to track a train using a specific train number.

input.action: 'Click the `TRAIN STATUS` tab', 'Change `SEARCH BY` to `Train Number`', 'Enter `66` in the `Train Number` field', 'Choose Station as `Newton, KS (NEW)`', 'Select a date as 18 July 2025', 'Click `CHECK STATUS`'

expected.outcome: The user is shown the status of train number 66 for the selected date.

prompt.name: Navigate to and Explore 'A New Era of Rail'
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the 'A New Era of Rail' page and verifies its content.

input.action: 'Scroll to the footer of the page', 'Under the `About Amtrak` section, click on `A New Era of Rail`', 'Verify that the page title is related to new era of rail', 'Browse the content of the page'

expected.outcome: The 'A New Era of Rail' page is displayed, showing information about Amtrak's development projects.

prompt.name: Find Information about Accessible Travel Services
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the accessible travel services page to find information.

input.action: 'Click on the `PLAN` link in the main navigation', 'Click on `Accessible Travel Services`', 'On the accessibility page, find and click on a link for more details about making a reservation'

expected.outcome: The user is on a page detailing how to make an accessible travel reservation.

prompt.name: Explore Trip Insurance and Reserved Parking
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the page about trip insurance and reserved parking.

input.action: 'Scroll to the footer', 'Under the `Traveling with Us` section, click on `Trip Insurance, Reserved Parking`', 'Verify that information about both trip insurance and parking is present'

expected.outcome: The user is on a page with information regarding trip insurance and reserved parking options.

prompt.name: Check Career Opportunities
prompt.instruction: go to https://www.amtrak.com/home.html and perform the following test case
prompt.description: User navigates to the careers page and searches for job openings.

input.action: 'Scroll to the footer of the page', 'Under the `About Amtrak` section, click on `Careers`', 'On the careers page, enter `Engineer` in the search bar', 'Click the search button'

expected.outcome: A list of job openings related to the 'Engineer' keyword is displayed.
